intro: Geissorhiza humilis var. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy geissorhiza, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive blue-violet coloration, often with a contrasting yellow center. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
